CreatureModelSet.Notes: DC 16 con to keep from throwing up

CreatureModel.Name: Escundu
CreatureModel.Lore: Ancient legends speak of a seelie fey who betrayed the Summer Queen. His true name has been stricken from history, but the stories call him Dubh Catha (“Dark Crow” in Common). So great was the Summer Queen’s wrath that she cursed every member of his house. Other fey refer to the descendants of Dubh Catha’s house as the dubh sith — or, in Common, “darklings.” Darklings most often settle in secluded caverns and chambers beneath the towns of other species. From such enclaves, they quietly ply their trade as thieves and assassins.

AttackModel.Name: Dagger
AttackModel.SpecialEffect: If the darkling has advantage on the attack roll, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) piercing damage.

TraitModel.Name: Death Flash
TraitModel.Description: When the darkling dies, nonmagical light flashes out from it in a 10-foot radius as its body and possessions, other than metal or magic objects, burn to ash. Any creature in that area and able to see the bright light must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the creature’s next turn.

TraitModel.Name: Light Sensitivity
TraitModel.Description: While in bright light, the darkling has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

CreatureModel.Name: Professor Bigglesworth
CreatureModel.Lore: Mages spend their lives in the study and practice of magic. Good-aligned mages offer counsel to nobles and others in power, while evil mages dwell in isolated sites to perform unspeakable experiments without interference.

ActiveEffectModel.Name: Mage Armor
ActiveEffectModel.Description: The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

TraitModel.Name: Spellcasting
TraitModel.Description: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

CreatureModel.Name: Kylara
CreatureModel.Lore: Mage who has dedicated themselves to fire magics.

CreatureModel.Name: Syrok
CreatureModel.Lore:
Salamanders slither across the Sea of Ash on the Elemental Plane of Fire, their sinuous coils and jagged spines smoldering. Intense heat washes off their bodies, while their yellow eyes glow like candles in the deep-set hollows of their hawkish faces.
Salamanders adore power, and they delight in setting fire to things. Outside their home plane, they play among the burning skeletons of charred trees as forest fires rage around them, or slither down the slopes of erupting volcanoes to linger in fire pits and magma floes.

AttackModel.Name: Tail
AttackModel.SpecialEffect: On hit, the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can't make tail attacks against other targets.

TraitModel.Name: Heated Body
TraitModel.Description: A creature that touches the snake or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

TraitModel.Name: Heated Weapons
TraitModel.Description: Any metal melee weapon the salamander wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

TraitModel.Name: Multiattack
TraitModel.Description: The salamander makes two attacks: one with its spear and one with its tail.

TraitModel.Name: Plagas Infection
TraitModel.Description: Once the creature becomes Bloodied or worse, its head bursts and one of two plagas variants emerges. A slashing plagas that has a reach of 10 ft, or a biting plagas.

CreatureModel.Name: Jester
CreatureModel.Lore: Trained in the way of martial arts from a monestary in which they were raised, they now travel the land to gain wordly experience.

TraitModel.Name: Multiattack
TraitModel.Description: The monk makes two attacks, one with the quarterstaff and one unarmed strike.

TraitModel.Name: Deflect Missiles
TraitModel.Description: Use reaction to reduce damage from a ranged weapon attack by 1d8+3.

TraitModel.Name: Damage Threshold
TraitModel.Description: Immunity to all damage unless it takes an amount of damage equal to or greater than 20.
